Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: 31Myriam_G
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at this hotel and it was great! Nice location, 5 minutes walk to the beach clubs (Mamita's and Kool) The Hotel gives new towels each morning and tickets to the Mamita's beach club (50% off). I think its the best location on the 5th avenue. The staff is friendly and the room nice. The bed are not very comfortable...its the only thing. I would go back to this hotel for sure! Myriam

Reviews.Title: “We stayed in the suite with a beautiful view.. The room and grounds were clean, well kept and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: lhart62
Reviews.Content: Great place.. We were in the heart of everything..we were on the top floor so it was very quiet and peaceful..

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, perhaps overpriced”
Reviews.Author: canadianfemale32
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful, the room was clean and spacious and nicely (although not spectacularly) decorated. I have no complaints about the hotel at all, except that the price seemed really high for what we got - I paid $82 on a last minute sale from $130 - maybe Playa is just expensive but based on Cancun centro prices I think a price of $70 non sale would have been more reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “great, clean, friendly, central location for short stay”
Reviews.Author: kmjamies
Reviews.Content: I stayed 1 night at Quinto Sol before i checked into my apartment nearby for the month. Jasmin was very helpful and nice about my spanglish. my room was on the 2nd floor (no elevator - difficult with heavy bags) and looked out onto Avenida Quinta, directly across from starbucks - in fact, starbucks patio dwellers could see me in my shower if i wasn't careful. The location is convenient but loud (not bad loud, just lots of people strolling and stores closing around 11pm), thus the suggestion that it is great for a short stay. Oh, and the wifi worked well in the hotel but not in my room (could have been my computer as i had a problem in Coffee Cafe as well -calle 34 and Ave quinta). room was clean and had the basic amenities. Did not eat at the attached restaurant, Cenaculo, but it was busy every night of my 1 month stay. Also, for the price ($78.00 deal), it was excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Cozy, confortable and nicely decorated hotel”
Reviews.Author: samykovac
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel right on 5th Ave. Friendly and helpfull staff, nice rooms. Jacuzzi on the roof, breakfast in closeby restaurant La Vagabunda, free beach towel service. We had a great stay there, and would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Somewhat disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Mapmanflan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent 5 night here and one of the reasons we picked it was for the kitchenette. However there was no microwave, the 2 burners were rusted and filthy, the coffee pot was dirty and broken and the freezer section of the refrigerator had so much frost on it I couldn't even get a bag of ice in it. (The hotel had no ice maker or ice cube trays to make our own ice, so had to buy ice at a convenience store down the street) Also, the floor was dirty so my wife ended up wearing old socks around all the time she was in the room so the bottom of her feet wouldnt get dirty!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for....”
Reviews.Author: williamj38
Reviews.Content: We got a deal here on Hotels.com for $54 a night. It turned out to be not a great deal. The rooms were average, nothing good or bad except the doors are flimsy and the door knobs are easily overpowered with no deadbolt. I constantly worried about someone breaking in while we were gone. The location was its ultimate advantage and extreme downfall! It is LOUD!!! The restaurant downstairs starts packing up anywhere from midnite to 2AM and bangs around for half an hour, moving tables, benches and platforms inside. The bars downstairs are crazy loud (Why do businesses in PdC think we want blaring music everywhere?). If you are in 201 or 301 you WILL NOT SLEEP. The internet worked okay and the staff was somewhat friendly but we were glad when it came time to move to another property.....

Reviews.Title: “I would be selfish for keeping this unique boutique Hotel a secret.”
Reviews.Author: RangerPeteTomah_Wi
Reviews.Content: I was a little hesitant about this review. But I would be selfish for keeping this unique boutique Hotel a secret. I’ve done a lot of traveling in my life and I've stayed in the best in the world. None compare with the charm and 1st class treatment by all. Everything about this hotel, location, pricing, helpful staff and a General Manager that rates as one of the best; getting me detailed flight boarding passes delivered to me personally and over all very helpful with other areas of interest; I will be making another trip to Playa soon and making my stay longer this time.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent staff, a bit overpriced”
Reviews.Author: malthe74
Reviews.Content: This was a good hotel, with excelent friendly staff. The room were OK but nothing special. The location was great two blocks from the beach, directly on the main street. Free highspeed internet in rooms. The rates were a little overpriced on what else is in Playa. But certainly a recommendable hotel

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel...”
Reviews.Author: playadict
Reviews.Content: Good hotel if you are busy taking in the scenery, not lounging at the hotel 24/7. If you want a resort, pay for a resort. If you want a nice, small hotel at the quieter end of Avenida 5, then Quinto Sol is a good choice. Try for the rooms on the 2nd, 3rd, or 4th floor though... the ones on the bottom funnel every sound into the room (until 2am or so) and are difficult to keep at a good temp. The fourth floor rooms are very nice and you can open windows to keep the fresh air coming. There is A/C in every room, but in Feb the breeze is really nice! The staff are non-intrusive, but helpful if you need them. The hotel is lovely during the day and night and has lounging areas that make for nice resting spots. It is a five minute walk to the beach and there are palapas for free that provide some shade. Try eating at La Distilleria... the arracherra steak is awesome! Pick up the discount coupon book that you can find everywhere and get some free food and drinks!

Reviews.Title: “Will be happy to stay here again !!”
Reviews.Author: rulitas
Reviews.Content: I usted to vacation in playa every year and know what to expect from these boutique hotels. this is not a resort like hotel, no great amenities, no elevator and no fancy extras. but is what Playa del Carmen is: relaxed, romantic, cool and no rush athmosphere. I rate it as as excellent because the staff. First I asked for a disccount and they give me an extra 10% if I pay in cash, second: we did not have umbrella for a rainning day and they got one that we use the entire day, this detail saved our day and third: we stay the first night in room 301 that is cool because window is right in the 5th avenue but very noisy at night. we asked to be moved to another room and they gave us a very nice and quit room that was like a studio with a small kitchen at no extra cost. We loved the location: right in the same street of mamitas beach club where we expend most of the time every day. Allso right in the front is a Starbucks and a bunch of cool places for dinner or have a nice mojitos or tequilas. Pros: clean, nice, staff and location, larger rooms compared to the average of bootique hotels. Cons: No elevator (if you have a problem with this), No restaurant (no problem at all for me). there are plenty in a walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “awfull experience”
Reviews.Author: waaragghhh122
Reviews.Content: nice hotel in fact but very bad management!! no restaurant at all! ugly food if you not are italian, better to avoid this place!!

Reviews.Title: “You get exactly what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: ohorsebrown
Reviews.Content: Big rooms, good location, smell of sewage emanating from toilet. What more can you ask for? I actually liked the place because the tree growing up through the atrium was cool, the staff was always nice but didn't bother me, and it had A/C. But I can see how some of the more finicky folks would complain about the toilet smell, the Best Western style of the rooms, and the construction noise in the morning. When I say, "you get exactly what you pay for," I mean it's worth the $40/night I paid when splitting the cost with two other buddies. If I was alone or picking up the tab for me and a babe, I might go for the next step up.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean hotel with a good location.”
Reviews.Author: b1j2m3c1
Reviews.Content: Is the Quinto Sol a resort, no. Is it a simple clean place to spend a few days in PDC yes. What do you want for $100 a night high season? We called during Easter Break on Monday for a mini-suite for Wednesday and it was no problem. All the employees were extremely helpful with the booking and on arrival. They took our bags to the room and refused a tip. We had a very early flight on Sunday morning and the cab arrangements they made were flawless (we were 5 minutes early and he'd been waiting 10).The room itself was clean and functional although the kitchen was sparsely outfitted with kitchenware. Breakfast is included at the restaurant on the main floor and was good but unremarkable. A very large hot tub is on the 2nd floor and offers a great view of 5th Avenue, nice to relax in while enjoying an afternoon cocktail. The hotel is located at an ideal location right on 5th Avenue actually towards the north end of the pedestrian wakway. It's a short 10 minute walk to Mamitas Beach Club. Another short 10 minute walk to the grocery store. It also seems a little quieter than some of the other hotels that are in the heart of 5th Ave because it is near the end. Would we stay at the Quinto Sol again? Sure, without any doubts although there are a number of other private hotels in Playa del Carmen that we would also like to try!

Reviews.Title: “Great Budget Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: megaflip
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Quinto Sol for five days in late February 2007. We arrived at 9am and the staff held our luggage for us before check in at 3pm. The staff was very nice and helpful. They called a cab for us and told us how to get to Tulum by city bus called ADO, which is an excellent way to travel to the ruins. The hotel is located on a very quiet section of La Quinta Avenida, but nearby construction made it difficult to sleep in past 8am. However, why would you want to sleep in late when you are in Mexico? I am sure they are done with the construction by now. There are only two complaints I can think of, but they wouldn't stop me from staying at this hotel again. The first is the shower temperature bordered on luke warm and the second is the bed was hard, which is very common for Mexican hotels. I have stayed at many hotels throughout Mexico and all the beds have the same stiffness. Staying at a budget hotel like this one allowed us to visit many restaurants on La Quinta and try a variety of cuisine. I loved this hotel and I definitely would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “booking with expedia????”
Reviews.Author: jhouse72
Reviews.Content: this is a clean, nice hotel. However, if you are booking with expedia, breakfast is NOT included. The service is a little less than friendly also.

Reviews.Title: “good location for the beach”
Reviews.Author: FinnishMexican
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Quinto Sol look very nice from the outside, but the rooms are very poor. they are big, but with very little furniture, there was not even a chair in our room! Just a desk and a bed. The shower looked inviting, but worked poorly. The location is great in relation to the best beach, Playa Mamitas, but not so great related to restaurants and the night scene.... Its a long walk back after bar hopping! The breakfast was suprisingly good and is included in the price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: minervaPuglia
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Quinto Sol in April 2007. The hotel structure is very nice and rooms are ok if you need to be in just to sleep and havea shower. It is ok and prices are good. Very well placed - 100 meters far from the beach and 50% discount on chairs and umbrellas at Mamita's beach club. Beach towel available at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fair, but there are better.”
Reviews.Author: MXR
Reviews.Content: This is a fair hotel for the price, but for $20 more I would suggest to stay at the Aventura Mexicana. The hotel is directly on 5th Ave, so it's not too quiet, especially if you're in Room 301. (Finding a hotel that's on a street in between 5th and 10th Ave will guarantee a lot more quiet.) It is built around a very small central arbor, just 12 feet across. That means you hear neighbors walking up and down. I found them very courteous and it's mostly fine, but there are better places. Finally, the shower in Rm 301 was a rain shower whose maximum amount of rain was drizzle.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Quinto Sol”
Reviews.Author: Vacation_Boi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Quinto Sol for our first three nights in the Mayan Riviera. We were very pleased with this hotel overall. It is in a great area at the north end of 5th Ave where there are lots of great restaurants, shops, etc, but away from the really touristy parts while still within walking distance to everything. It is only a short walk to the beach. Hotel covers 50% of cost of chairs at Mamita's Beach Club (which is a fabulous beach), but it would be nice if they covered the full cost as some other hotels do. The hotel is very attractive and clean, with great character. For the first two nights we had the room above the front entrance with a balcony over the street. Very nice, although this was pretty loud until the pubs closed at night - so keep that in mind. Our third night was upstairs away from the street and that was better. Both rooms were somewhat dark - more lighting is needed. There was not much hot water either, but we survived that. We thought we were getting free breakfast, but then it was explained that breakfast is free only after staying for two nights - so it would be good to clarify this and bring the email confirmation with you. The breakfasts were good and waiter very friendly. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. They had lots of friendly advice and responded very promptly when we needed a light bulb replaced, etc. This certainly contributed greatly to our positive experience. A more accurate rating would be 3.5 out of 5, if that were an option (not quite a 4). All in all we enjoyed our stay at Quinto Sol and would be happy to return in future.

Reviews.Title: “A small, lovely place in mediterranean style”
Reviews.Author: AlessandroCossu
Reviews.Content: This was a great discover for me, at the 4th time in Playa. Located in the most quiet part of the Quinta Avenida (the central avenue of Playa), is near to Mama Playa, a beautiful place to stay and take sun, even in its "clubby" beach. It has an italian restaurant too, Limoni, wich is followed by an italian manager. The hotel is in mediterranean style, with a little but lovely caribbean garden in the middle. It has a Jacuzzi for 6 people located on the roof. The peculiarity is a great shower for a nice and relaxant one after a day on the white sand beach. Ask for a little discount!

Reviews.Title: “A gem for the budget conscious.”
Reviews.Author: travelerunlimited
Reviews.Content: A gem for the budget conscious. Inexpensive,simple, clean, and great location. Hotel is located on the main street Ave. 5 where you will find all of the action, cafes, shops, and restraurants. It is a block away from the beach. This hotel had a European feel, most of the guest were European. Italian restaraunt is located downstairs. Friendly, multilingual staff and very accomodating providing us with recommendations on placed to eat among our favorites were La Cueva Del Chango, La Fe and Babes(all reasonably priced). We stayed in two different rooms because we wanted the one with the balcony and it wasn't available at the time of our arrival. Rooms were very comfortable and spacious yet dark and towels needed to be replaced with new ones. The room with the balcony towards Ave. 5 was a bit noisy at night(we had our 4 yr. old with us). Overall, we had a great time, despite the fact that it was a last minute trip(3 days prior to departing). We would would definately consider staying at Hotel Quinto Sol again.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable price for average room”
Reviews.Author: Lily112
Reviews.Content: Positvies: -Located on one end of main street but within easy walking distance of all restaurants and shopping. -Roof top jacuzzi open to all guests with an incredible view. -Short walk to beach. -Relatively inexpensive and clean. Negatives: -The room didn't have good lighting and the mattress was thin. -If any food or drink was left out an ant problem would occur. -Thin towels. If you are on a budget this is a good deal; however, if you want luxury this isn't the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad for the Price”
Reviews.Author: Lynn R
Reviews.Content: There was nothing special about this hotel, except that it is visually very cool. The bedroom and bathroom was your typical Mexican room. The lighting, however, was horrible and we had to leave our draperies wide open to get any light....which left us in full view of the other hotel guests. We asked for extra towels as there were 3 of us in the room, and sometimes got them - sometimes didn't. I got the feeling that if you were Italian you were probably taken care of very well, otherwise you were just another peso to them. Location was very nice if you don't want to be in the thick of things.

Reviews.Title: “Good Spot”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It was our first time to Playa, so we stayed in many different hotels in order to see what the town had to offer. Hotel Quinto Sol is the best bang for your buck. Staff was very accomodating and friendly, and english was not a problem when communicating. The hotel is situated right on fifth avenue but seemed to be a bit less crowded compared to other parts of the strip. We stayed in two different rooms. Both were large, very clean, and not outdated. A continental breakfast was included with our stay. The air conditioning ran perfectly, and there was a mini fridge there to keep the beer cold. The second room we stayed in had a kitchenette. No stove, but had a hotplate. The price was perfect for what we received. Weren't overly impressed with Playa in general, but if we ever do return we will be sure to stay at Hotel Quinto Sol.

Reviews.Title: “Great Small Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We loved the Quinto Sol! It is simple, cool and soothing, in the style of a small European hotel. The northern location is great - within walking distance of the heart of touristy downtown but not too close, and only 2 blocks from primo beach. Dozens of restaurant options are within a short walk. The price is right and the multilingual staff is discreetly professional. We stayed in a ground floor room in the back which was quiet and cool all day, a welcome change from the sunny streets and beach. The shady garden in the center courtyard is lovely, with flowers, butterflies, and a few tiny lizards running up the huge tree. Get a room in the back of the hotel if you want ultra quiet, as there is a lively Italian bistro across 5th Ave. where people talk and sing until the wee hours. The only negative worth mentioning is the hard (HARD!) platform beds - must be authentic Mexican mattresses... They are actually refreshing if you have back problems or a sunburn. If you are looking for conventional American amenities, go elsewhere. If you are looking for a quality European-style small hotel, check out this one. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Gracious Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: myseablue
Reviews.Content: Personal touch made my stay a positive one. Clean, unique rooms, AC functioned well in a most humid environment. Almost invisible bugs around bed area was the only unpleasantness during my stay and Simone and Natasha were quick to deal with the problem. When I needed a couple laundry items done, the staff handled with no question. My morning cafe was so tasty as was the orange juice, freshly squeezed. The ambiance was quaint and inviting. I felt most welcome and the total staff were most helpful. Great time in Playa. I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Little Hotel !!!”
Reviews.Author: Silky_P
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a stay at Hotel Quinto Sol, and it was great! Very clean, great housekeeping and ccccccold A/C. Beds are very firm. Handy location at the northern part of the main drag Avendida Quinto (or 5th Ave). You can walk everywhere! Staff was exceptional (especially Natasha) ready with beach towels, wake-up calls and help on trips/excursions. Recommend highly!!!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Quinto Sol
HotelInfo.Address: 5th Avenue & 28, Playa del Carmen 77710, Mexico
